info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Prowers, southeastern Kiowa and northeastern Bent Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 713 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms developing along a line extending from near McClave to 9 miles northeast of Lamar to 10 miles northwest of Bristol. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, penny size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wiley, Neeoshe Reservoir, McClave, Sweetwater Reservoir, Chivington, Brandon, Neegronda Reservoir and Queens Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
